definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: In America, when they vote, citizens are influenced by family traditions.
sentences.chinese: 在美國投票選舉時受家庭傳統影響。

sentences.english: The voting system is weighted against the smaller parties.
sentences.chinese: 投票選舉制度對小黨派很不利。

sentences.english: He's only 17 and therefore not eligible to vote.
sentences.chinese: 他只有17歲，因此沒有投票選舉的資格。

sentences.english: All the winners are determined by votes through website casted by readers.
sentences.chinese: 所有的獎項均由雜誌的讀者通過網絡票選統計得出。

sentences.english: Instead, they vote to elect a board ofdirectors.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是，股東投票選舉出董事會。

sentences.english: Its members, who numbered in the hundreds, were instructed not to vote.
sentences.chinese: 它的信衆成百上千，都被指使不參與投票選舉。

sentences.english: The right to vote at shareholder’s meetings for the election of directors shall be observed.
sentences.chinese: 應該遵守股東大會上投票選舉董事的表決權。

sentences.english: However, election officials say tabulations have not been completed and are preliminary.
sentences.chinese: 但是選舉官員說票選表還沒有完成且仍處於初級階段。

sentences.english: It is ridiculous that European countries possess about a third of the votes.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲國家佔有三分之一的票選是荒謬的。

definition: to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to call for entries and select the best/to solicit (entries, submissions, applications etc)/to select (the best candidate)/contest/competition
to compete/to take part in a competition
to win an election/to get a position by passing the imperial exam
to announce publicly/to publish/to make known/to disclose
